tasks.prompt: Confirm `.claude/commands` frontmatter + placeholders are sufficient for deterministic multi-platform compilation.
tasks.decision: Use a compiler approach: expand `{SCRIPT:*}`/`{AGENT_SCRIPT}`/`$ARGUMENTS` from command frontmatter and emit platform artifacts.
tasks.rationale: cc-devflow command files already contain structured frontmatter and deterministic placeholders, enabling compile-time generation without a runtime template engine.

tasks.prompt: Design deterministic compilation outputs per platform.
tasks.decision: Emit compiled artifacts to per-platform folders: `.codex/.cursor/.qwen/.agent`.
tasks.rationale: Matches platform-native consumption while keeping `.claude/` as SSOT.

tasks.prompt: Analyze spec-kit source code for placeholder replacement and multi-agent packaging patterns.
tasks.decision: Adopt spec-kit placeholder replacement patterns via compile-time transforms (not runtime helpers).
tasks.rationale: spec-kit replaces {SCRIPT}/{ARGS} at build time. cc-devflow can do the same by compiling `.claude/commands` into target platform artifacts.
alternatives: Copy spec-kit's release zip templating (not aligned with SSOT in-repo)
